sn3.23:1.2: Seated to one side, King Pasenadi said to the Buddha,
sn3.23:1.3: “Sir, how many things arise in the world for its harm, suffering, and discomfort?”
sn3.23:1.4: “Great king, three things arise in the world for its harm, suffering, and discomfort.
sn3.23:1.9: These three things arise in the world for its harm, suffering, and discomfort.”
sn3.23:1.10: That is what the Buddha said. …
sn3.23:2.3: they harm a person of wicked heart,
sn3.23:2.4: as a reed is destroyed by its own fruit.”
